original: Kjessler, Hans Åke Berndt, leg. läkare, Göteborg, f. 23/6/07 i Hälsingborg av dir. Bernt K. o. Jenny Toep-fer. G. 1. 31 m. Carin Braathen, d. 34; 2. 37 m. Viviane Börjesson. Barn: Berndt f. 34, Björn 39, Yvonne 42, Pieter 46. — Stud:ex. i Hälsingborg 26, med. kand. i Upps. 30, med. lic. i Sthlm 35. E. läk. v. Porla brunn 32, assist :läk. o. und :’läk. v. Hälsingborgs las. kir. avd. 36-37, järnv :läk. i Storlien 37-38, assist :läk., e. läk. samt aman. v. gynekol. o. obstetr. klan. i Lund 38-39, und:l’äk. v. obs-tetr.- gynekok avd. å Norrköp. las. 39, und:~ läk. o. bitr. läk. v. Radiumhemm. gynekol. avd. 39-41, und :iäk. v. kir. avd. å Nyköp. las. 41-42, und :läk. å kvin-noklin. i Gbg 42-47 samt tf. barnmorskelär. v. barnmorskeläroanst. i Gbg 44-47.
translated: Kjessler, Hans Åke Berndt, M.D., Gothenburg, born June 23, 1907 in Helsingborg to director Bernt K. and Jenny Toepfer. First marriage in 1931 to Carin Braathen, deceased in 1934; second marriage in 1937 to Viviane Börjesson. Children: Berndt, born in 1934, Björn in 1939, Yvonne in 1942, Pieter in 1946. Completed high school in Helsingborg in 1926, earned a Bachelor of Medicine degree in Uppsala in 1930, received a medical doctorate in Stockholm in 1935. Worked as a physician at Porla Health Spa in 1932, worked as an assistant and then as a deputy physician at the surgical department of Helsingborg Hospital from 1936-1937, worked as a railway physician in Storlien from 1937-1938, worked as an assistant physician and then as a doctor and trainee at the gynecology and obstetrics clinic in Lund from 1938-1939, worked as an assistant physician at the obstetrics-gynecology department of Norrköping Hospital in 1939, worked as a deputy physician and assistant physician at the gynecology department of Radiumhemmet from 1939-1941, worked as a deputy physician at the surgical department of Nyköping Hospital from 1941-1942, worked as a doctor at the women's clinic in Gothenburg from 1942-1947, and temporarily served as a lecturer in midwifery at the midwifery training institute in Gothenburg from 1944-1947.
